definition: to charge (an entity) with (a task)/to assign (sb) the task of
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: She was enjoined to live more frugally.
sentences.chinese: 她被责成更俭省地生活。

sentences.english: The Shareholder shall cause the Company to report such appointment to the original examination and approval authority for the record.
sentences.chinese: 股东应责成公司将该委任报原审批机关备案。

sentences.english: The general ordered me to strategize.
sentences.chinese: 将军责成我制订战略行动计划。

sentences.english: Top management assembles a special committee to assess the promotability of all the employees.
sentences.chinese: 总经理责成某个委员会去评价全部职员的潜力。

sentences.english: Enjoin the Defendant permanently from violating its own organization bylaws .
sentences.chinese: 责成被告永不违反其组织章程。

sentences.english: The principal shall be obliged to pay the wages to the employees.
sentences.chinese: 必须责成雇主向雇员支付薪金。

sentences.english: The State Council has paid great attention to it and obliged the related departments to investigate it carefully.
sentences.chinese: 国务院对此高度重视，责成有关部门进行了认真研究。

definition: to order/to enjoin/to charge/to instruct sb to finish sth
to report, requesting approval/written request for instructions
to report to one's superiors/to appear in the news/to reply to a letter
Huitong county in Huaihua 懷化|怀化[Huai2 hua4], Hunan
to file for investigation/to prosecute (a case)
to set a time limit/time limit/deadline
to approve and forward/to endorse/stamp "approved for distribution"
